name: CssRect
comment:
A class for representing CSS dimensions.

In contrast to the more general purpose dart-dom-html.Rectangle class, this class's values are mutable, so one can change the height of an element programmatically.

Important note: use of these methods will perform CSS calculations that can trigger a browser reflow. Therefore, use of these properties during an animation frame is discouraged. See also: Browser Reflow

left.name: left
left.comment:
The x-coordinate of the left edge.

Setting the value will move the rectangle without changing its width.

top.name: top
top.comment:
The y-coordinate of the left edge.

Setting the value will move the rectangle without changing its height.

height=.name: height=
height=.comment:
Set the height to newHeight.

newHeight can be either a dart-core.num representing the height in pixels or a dart-dom-html.Dimension object. Values of newHeight that are less than zero are converted to effectively setting the height to 0. This is equivalent to the height function in jQuery and the calculated height CSS value, converted to a num in pixels.

Note that only the content height can actually be set via this method.

width=.name: width=
width=.comment:
Set the current computed width in pixels of this element.

newWidth can be either a dart-core.num representing the width in pixels or a dart-dom-html.Dimension object. This is equivalent to the width function in jQuery and the calculated width CSS value, converted to a dimensionless num in pixels.

Note that only the content width can be set via this method.

height.name: height
height.comment:
The height of this rectangle.

This is equivalent to the height function in jQuery and the calculated height CSS value, converted to a dimensionless num in pixels. Unlike getBoundingClientRect, height will return the same numerical width if the element is hidden or not.

width.name: width
width.comment:
The width of this rectangle.

This is equivalent to the width function in jQuery and the calculated width CSS value, converted to a dimensionless num in pixels. Unlike getBoundingClientRect, width will return the same numerical width if the element is hidden or not.

width=.name: width=
width=.comment:
Sets the width of the rectangle.

The width must be non-negative. If a negative width is supplied, it is clamped to zero.

Setting the value will change the right edge of the rectangle, but will not change dart-math.MutableRectangle.left.

height=.name: height=
height=.comment:
Sets the height of the rectangle.

The height must be non-negative. If a negative height is supplied, it is clamped to zero.

Setting the value will change the bottom edge of the rectangle, but will not change dart-math.MutableRectangle.top.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides dart-dom-html.CssRect.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and dart-dom-html.CssRect.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the dart-dom-html.CssRect.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
dart-dom-html.CssRect.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to dart-dom-html.CssRect.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If dart-dom-html.CssRect.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of dart-dom-html.CssRect.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

intersection.name: intersection
intersection.comment:
Computes the intersection of this and dart-dom-html.CssRect.intersection.other.

The intersection of two axis-aligned rectangles, if any, is always another axis-aligned rectangle.

Returns the intersection of this and other, or null if they don't intersect.

boundingBox.name: boundingBox
boundingBox.comment: Returns a new rectangle which completely contains this and dart-dom-html.CssRect.boundingBox.other.

containsPoint.name: containsPoint
containsPoint.comment: Tests whether dart-dom-html.CssRect.containsPoint.another is inside or along the edges of this.
